question: A and B are two sets having 3 and 6 elements respectively. Consider the following statements.
Statement (I): Minimum number of elements in <katex>$A \cup B$</katex> is 3
Statement (II): Maximum number of elements in <katex>$A \cap B$</katex> is 3
Which of the following is correct?
choices: Statement (I) is true, statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false, statement (II) is true
explanation: Statement I: <katex>$|A \cup B| = |A| + |B| - |A \cap B|$</katex>. Min value occurs when overlap is max. Max overlap is 3. Min union = 3 + 6 - 3 = 6. Statement I says 3, which is false.
Statement II: Max overlap <katex>$|A \cap B|$</katex> is <katex>$\min(|A|, |B|) = 3$</katex>. Statement II is true.
